intro: Phyllanthus jaffrei, commonly known as the Jaffrei phyllanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features include glandular hairs on the foliage and a distinctive fruit structure. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
